title: WCAS LING 380-0-20 Spoken English for Non-Native Speakers

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is focused on fluency and comprehensibility in conversation in both informal and academic settings. It is designed to help students develop and refine their English conversation, discussion, and discourse skills. While some attention will be given to American English intonation, word stress, and pronunciation, the primary purpose of this class is to explore functions of American English important for fluency in conversational speech. This will help improve your performance on tasks and activities involving spoken English, such as oral proficiency exams, presentations, teaching, and day-to-day social interactions.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The skills that students will learn in this class are applicable in a variety of situations, including conferences, class presentations, reports at lab meetings, and job interviews.

subject: LING
